intro: Psychotria kivuensis, commonly known as the Kivu psychotria, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, white or pale green flowers. It is often found in shaded, humid environments such as tropical rainforests. Psychotria kivuensis is also noted for its potential ethnobotanical uses, though further research is needed to fully understand its properties.
